timeline.summary: On May 10, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein sent a revised and shortened memo for ODAG (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, Public Corruption Unit) to Audrey Strauss, Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit. The memo was attached to an email sent from his iPhone.

This document, likely a whistleblower’s collection of evidence, alleges a complex network of corruption involving prominent figures and financial institutions. Here's a breakdown of the key points: *   **Stephen M. Calk and Presidential Administration:** The initial email details Calk’s alleged attempts to secure a position within the Trump administration in exchange for approving $16 million in loans. *   **SEC Investigations & Pump & Dump Schemes:** The document highlights multiple SEC investigations, primarily focused on Phillip Frost’s alleged involvement in pump-and-dump stock schemes and the operation of Alpha Capital Liechtenstein. It accuses the SEC of deliberately allowing fraudulent activities to continue. *   **Connections to Apollo, Epstein, Kushner, and Putin:** A central theme is the interconnectedness of Apollo Global Management, Leon Black, Jeffrey Epstein, and Jared Kushner. The document suggests links between these individuals and alleged money laundering schemes involving entities like DryShips, Russia’s fund backing, and various shell corporations. *   **Regulatory Failures:** The text accuses the SEC of systemic corruption, allowing fraudulent activities to persist and failing to adequately investigate key individuals and firms, pointing to instances where the SEC seemingly aided Kushner Companies and other problematic entities. *   **Targeted Individuals/Entities:** Specific names repeatedly mentioned include: Stephen Feinberg (Cerberus), George Economou (DryShips), Marc Bistricer (Toronto-based investment houses), and various firms like OMV Management, Wilmer Hale, and Krieger Kim & Lewin. *   **Ongoing Investigation and Threats:** The final pages reveal the whistleblower’s frustration with the SEC’s inaction and expresses a belief that the investigation is aimed at intimidating him. The overall narrative presented is a highly critical one, accusing a network of powerful individuals and institutions of systemic fraud and corruption, with the SEC failing to act decisively.

On July 6, 2019, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) sent an email update to multiple recipients regarding an investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The update included the following key information: Judge Moses signed a search warrant, FBI received a flight manifest listing Epstein and two pilots from CBP, and the FBI is attempting to confirm the passengers after the flight takes off. Laura Birger (USANYS) and Audrey Strauss (USANYS) were also involved in the communication.

Audrey Strauss is on trial before Judge Ronnie Abrams and will be checking email at the end of each trial day.  For urgent matters related to Cr. 490 (RMB), contact AUSA. For other matters, contact AUSA.

Audrey Strauss (USANYS) sent a message to [REDACTED] (USANYS) regarding a transcript of a hearing. She offered to send the transcript and then call, and was available to do updates. Strauss indicated that “[REDACTED]” was requesting the transcript.
Audrey Strauss (USANYS) docketed letters exchanged between Bruce Green and Judge Berman, dated September 4, 2019. The letters are attached to the email.

Craig Stewart (USANYS) sent a draft of the “Priorities webpage” to Audrey Strauss (USANYS) on November 5, 2019, for review. The draft requires formatting edits, stylistic adjustments (specifically regarding the Combatting Corruption entries), and substantive decisions about content additions or deletions. Visuals for some subpages are incomplete; some have existing visuals accessible via Ctrl+click, while others are pending Nick’s completion. A link to the “Thwarting and Responding to Acts of Terror and Enforcing International Sanctions” subpage is also included.
An email was sent from [REDACTED] to Audrey Strauss (USANYS) regarding an Epstein Travel & Expense (T&E) meeting. The email was sent on January 8, 2020.

An email chain discusses a potential witness regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The original sender forwarded an email from an individual identifying themselves as a victim and witness, requesting a meeting with Assistant U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to discuss the case.

Audrey Strauss (USANYS) sent a message to [REDACTED] forwarding comments regarding revisions to a document titled “Ghislaine_Maxwell_Press_Remarks_v3.docx.” She requested feedback to shift the tone away from an indictment-like style and towards a more accessible, conversational approach.

On June 28, 2020, Audrey Strauss (USANYS) received draft remarks and a Q&A from an unnamed sender regarding potential press materials for Ghislaine Maxwell. Strauss requested edits to simplify the language and shorten sentences, and sent the revised materials (Ghislaine Maxwell_Press_Remarks_v3_(ig_edits).docx and Maxwell possible QA v2.docx) back to the sender for further consideration.

Email exchanges between individuals regarding a "Cheat Sheet" attached on June 30, 2020. The Cheat Sheet details information related to Counts, including statutes, time periods, underlying lies, statutes of limitations, and the sex trafficking statute charged against Epstein and Maxwell. A request was made to add exposure information to the Cheat Sheet.

Audrey Strauss sent an email requesting a resend of a Q and A document (“Maxwell_possible_QA_v2.docx”) for a 3:30 Q and A preparation. The email thread originated from [REDACTED] and included a response from [REDACTED]. Strauss is a Deputy United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

On July 1, 2020, at XX:00 p.m., Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, will hold a press conference at the U.S. Attorney’s Office to announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein. The press conference will be livestreamed on Facebook and will adhere to mandatory COVID-19 protocols.

Audrey Strauss (USANYS) was requesting a telephone number to announce per press remarks. Ori provided the number 1-800-CALL-FBI, after Strauss had difficulty obtaining it from the FBI regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

*   The press conference will be held on July 1, 2020, at the U.S. Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York. *   Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney, and an FBI Assistant Director-in-Charge will lead the conference. *   Logistics are being discussed, including venue selection (initially the lobby was considered, then Plan B/Z – using the whole lobby) and COVID-19 safety protocols (masks, social distancing, step-and-repeat backdrop). *   The FBI is assisting with arrangements, including securing chairs, checking capacity, and addressing acoustic concerns. *   A paragraph is needed for the press advisory to outline safety protocols and request extra time for press entry. *   The planned timing of the arrest is uncertain, with potential pushes to Thursday.

Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York with conspiring to sexually abuse minors alongside Jeffrey Epstein. The charges include enticing a minor to travel for criminal sexual activity, transporting a minor with intent to engage in such activity, conspiracy to commit these offenses, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. Maxwell allegedly recruited, groomed, and transported young girls to Epstein’s residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, facilitating abuse that included sexualized massages and direct participation in acts of abuse. She made false statements during a 2016 deposition. The case is being prosecuted by Audrey Strauss and involves the FBI and NYPD. The indictment outlines a pattern of abuse and manipulation of vulnerable young women.

On July 2, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, requested Judge Katharine H. Parker to unseal Indictment 20 Cr. 330, which involves the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. Judge Parker granted this request, ordering the indictment to remain unsealed pending further court orders. The case is designated as a "Wheel C" case.

On July 2, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, requested the unsealing of Indictment 20 Cr. 330 in the case of Ghislaine Maxwell. The United States District Court, under Judge Katharine H. Parker, granted the request to unseal the indictment. The case is designated as a "Wheel C" case.

Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged by the USDOJ with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors. The charges include enticing a minor to travel for criminal sexual activity, transporting a minor with intent to commit such acts, conspiracy to commit these offenses, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. Maxwell allegedly facilitated and participated in abuse, grooming victims, and manipulating their behavior to enable Epstein’s actions, occurring across locations including New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London. The indictment alleges she repeatedly made false statements under oath. The FBI and NYPD have been involved in the investigation, emphasizing the importance of protecting children and holding perpetrators accountable. The case is being prosecuted by Audrey Strauss and a team from the Southern District of New York.

Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged by the United States Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York with conspiring to sexually abuse minors alongside Jeffrey Epstein. The charges include enticing a minor to travel, transporting a minor with intent to commit sexual abuse, conspiracy to commit these offenses, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. Maxwell allegedly facilitated the grooming and abuse of minor girls, including by recruiting them, arranging travel to Epstein’s residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and participating in sexual acts. She repeatedly made false statements during depositions. The case is being prosecuted by Audrey Strauss and involves the FBI and NYPD. The indictment details specific grooming behaviors and instances of abuse, highlighting Maxwell’s central role in the scheme.

Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York with conspiring to sexually abuse minors alongside Jeffrey Epstein. The charges include enticing a minor to travel for criminal sexual activity, transporting a minor with intent to engage in such activity, conspiracy to commit these offenses, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. Maxwell is accused of facilitating Epstein’s abuse of young girls, including grooming, transporting them to locations across the US and England, and participating in the abuse itself. The indictment details specific manipulative tactics used to lure and control the victims, and Maxwell made false statements during a 2016 deposition. The case is being prosecuted by Audrey Strauss and involves the FBI and NYPD.

On July 2, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Audrey Strauss, requested Judge Katharine H. Parker to unseal Indictment 20 Cr. 330, which involves the case of Ghislaine Maxwell. The court granted the request, ordering the indictment to remain unsealed pending further order. The case is designated as a "Wheel C" case.

Audrey Strauss (USANYS) sent an email thanking a team for their work on the Epstein and Maxwell investigations, acknowledging the "byzantine legal issues" and challenges with witnesses. She praised the team's ingenuity and contribution to bringing an indictment. Strauss also expressed anticipation for a team Webex and wished the team a pleasant holiday weekend.

Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing, transporting, and abusing young girls (as young as 14) across multiple states (New York, Florida, New Mexico, and England). The charges include perjury related to 2016 depositions. Maxwell allegedly groomed victims, facilitated Epstein’s abuse, and made false statements during depositions. The FBI and NYPD investigated, and the case is being prosecuted by the Southern District of New York under Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.  The indictment alleges a pattern of abuse occurring from at least 1994 through 1997, involving manipulative behaviors designed to make victims vulnerable.

On July 17, 2020, Anthony V. Lombardino contacted Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney, to request an interview with a former inmate at Clinton Correctional Facility, identified as “asiewasiti,tho”. This inmate claims to have information regarding the deaths of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as information about an individual known as “J. Doe”. Lombardino believes the inmate possesses vital information relevant to the investigation and requests Strauss’s assistance in interviewing him.

Audrey Strauss, a U.S. Attorney, sent draft comments to the Epstein estate trustees' counsel regarding a letter addressing issues related to the 1953 Trust Agreement. The letter included a question about a waiver of attorney-client privilege for the trustees’ discovery review. The Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York initially drafted the letter.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, responded to a request for information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Jane Doe in the case *Doe v. Indyke et al*. The response was governed by Department regulations (“Told°”) restricting disclosure of information acquired during official duties without prior approval. Due to an upcoming pretrial conference and existing discovery exchanges, the Department determined disclosures were appropriate. As a result, redacted versions of FedEx invoices (USDOL0001-0040) and electronic search warrant documents (USDOL0041-0052) were provided, with one page (USDOJ_0053) containing a photograph of the client. The documents were redacted to exclude references to third parties, particularly to protect grand jury secrecy.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, is responding to a request from Jeffrey S. Pagliuca regarding the use of discovery materials from the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (Bates Nos. SDNY GM 00000834-00000962) in a civil lawsuit. The government maintains that the materials remain under seal due to an ongoing grand jury investigation and a Protective Order limiting their use to the criminal defense. They assert that Pagliuca’s request is unclear regarding his role (defense counsel vs. civil attorney) and that any attempt to access the materials through FOIA or a Toughy request would be subject to the Protective Order’s restrictions. The government directs Pagliuca to contact the Civil Division for assistance.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, responded to a request from Jeffrey S. Pagliuca, Esq., regarding the use of discovery materials from the criminal case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (Bates Nos. SDNY GM _ 00000834 through SDNY_ GM_ 00000962) in a civil lawsuit. The Government maintains that the materials remain under seal due to ongoing investigation and a Protective Order restricting their use to the defense of the criminal case. The Protective Order explicitly prohibits using the discovery materials in any civil proceeding. If the request is made in the capacity of Ms. Maxwell’s attorney in a civil lawsuit, the Government directs Pagliuca to utilize Freedom of Information Act requests or Toughy requests, referring him to the Civil Division for assistance.

On August 13, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, sent a document to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department regarding the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The communication included the password for a drive containing discovery materials. Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney, signed the document.

Emails dated September 1, 2020, and July 1, 2020, detail revisions to a document titled “GM remarks,” likely pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell. Multiple individuals, including Audrey Strauss (USANYS), [REDACTED], and [REDACTED], participated in the editing process to shorten and refine the text, ensuring alignment with the indictment. The document was provided in various iterations, with the final version identified as “v14 (Clean Copy) jig_edits).”

On October 2, 2020, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department. The materials were enclosed for Ghislaine Maxwell (inmate 02879-509) to access.

On October 2, 2020, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent a notification to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department regarding the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The communication included the password “USAOsdnyl!” for a drive containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell (case file 02879-509).

The U.S. Department of Justice, Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, is sending a drive containing discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center. The drive’s access password is provided.

On October 2, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center. The materials were enclosed for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (ID: 02879-509) and were provided by Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss.

The U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the Metropolitan Detention Center’s Legal Department. The materials are for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (ID: 02879-509).

On October 19, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department. The materials were contained in a package labeled “The passes” (02879-509) and were sent by Federal Express. Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney, signed the correspondence.

On October 29, 2020, Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney, sent a document to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department regarding the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The document is a notification containing the password for a CD containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell (case file 02879-509).

On November 9, 2020, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the Metropolitan Detention Center – Brooklyn. The materials were intended for Ghislaine Maxwell (inmate ID 02879-509) and were provided by Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney.

On November 9, 2020, Audrey Strauss, Acting United States Attorney, sent a document to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY, regarding the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The document provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell (case file 02879-509).

A transmittal letter and the final OPR report regarding the Jeffrey Epstein matter were sent to Audrey Strauss on November 12, 2020. The report included exhibits. The document is identified as EFTA00028679.

On November 18, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY, for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (ID: 02879-509).

This document is a letter from the United States Attorney, Audrey Strauss, to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY, regarding the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The letter provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell (case file 02879-509). The letter was sent on December 3, 2020.

The U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Southern District of New York, is providing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell, inmate 02879-509, at the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center. The materials relate to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The document is dated December 3, 2020, and sent by Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss.

On December 16, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, produced discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330). The materials, stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_00274187 through SDNY_GM_0274303, were provided to counsel for the defense (Cohen & Gresser LLP, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., and Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim).  A PDF file, EFTA00019420, was produced, and the government states it will continue to produce additional discoverable material as needed.

On December 16, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, produced discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330). The materials, stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_00274187 through SDNY_GM_0274302, were sent to counsel representing the defense (Cohen & Gresser LLP, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., and Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim). The production includes a PDF file named EFTA00019422, dated 06.20.2018, and a Bates number range. The letter notes the governing Protective Order and the Government's commitment to ongoing discovery.

On December 17, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department. The materials were enclosed for Ghislaine Maxwell’s access.

On December 17, 2020, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, sent a disc containing discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department. The disc was sent via Federal Express.

The document details the U.S. Attorney selection process for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), specifically focusing on potential successors to Audrey Strauss. President Biden is initiating a nationwide replacement of Trump-appointed U.S. Attorneys. While Strauss’s position is being evaluated, the SDNY application process is active with a large candidate pool. Three lawyers identified as potential successors are: Damian Williams (head of the Securities and Commodities Fraud Task Force), Katherine Goldstein (a white-collar fraud specialist), and Anjan Sahni (also a former Task Force chief).  Chuck Schumer holds significant sway over the process, and there are strong connections to Preet Bharara, who previously held the position. The document cites a Law360 article discussing the process and highlighting the importance of the Garland clerk chain for potential picks.

President Biden is initiating the selection process for the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), following the departure of Audrey Strauss. The process involves a large pool of candidates, including Damian Williams, Katherine Goldstein, and Anjan Sahni.  Damian Williams is favored due to his experience and connection to Merrick Garland’s clerk chain. Katherine Goldstein is seen as a strong candidate for modernizing enforcement, and Anjan Sahni’s trial win is considered a valuable asset. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer holds significant influence over the selection, and Preet Bharara maintains a direct line to Schumer for guidance.

On March 16, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department. The materials were intended for Ghislaine Maxwell (inmate ID 02879-509) and were provided by Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney.

Audrey Strauss (USANYS) responded to a message from Maurene regarding a “friendly subpoena” being sent to an attorney. The Maxwell team is seeking a copy of a settlement agreement between Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, provided by M, who believes a subpoena is necessary. The agreement is relevant to an ongoing investigation into Maxwell’s involvement in the abuse of underage girls.

An email chain discusses a “friendly subpoena” being sent to attorney Audrey Strauss regarding a settlement agreement between Maxwell and Epstein. The attorney has a copy of the agreement and is willing to provide it, contingent on receiving a subpoena. The agreement is relevant to an ongoing investigation into Maxwell’s involvement in the abuse of underage girls.

An email exchange occurred between [REDACTED] and Audrey Strauss (USANYS) regarding a “friendly subpoena” sent to an attorney. The attorney possesses a copy of a settlement agreement between Maxwell and Epstein from 2009. He requires a subpoena to provide a copy of the agreement, which is relevant to an investigation into Maxwell’s involvement in the abuse of underage girls. The email references court filings and deposition transcripts from a related civil case.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, issued a grand jury subpoena to the Interlochen Center for the Arts on March 26, 2021, requesting student records related to alleged violations of federal criminal law (18 U.S.C. §§ 2423(a), 1591). The subpoena demands that Interlochen refrain from disclosing its existence to third parties.  If records are produced electronically, they must be accompanied by a Declaration of Custodian of Records confirming their authenticity. Failure to comply will result in contempt of court and potential civil and criminal penalties. The subpoena specifies a court appearance date of April 12, 2021, at 10 a.m.

On March 29, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, produced discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The materials, stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_02743103 through SDNY_GM_02743292, were sent to counsel representing Ghislaine Maxwell – Christian Everdell, Mark Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim – and are governed by a Protective Order dated July 31, 2020. An index of the materials is included, detailing their Bates numbers and descriptions. The Government states it will promptly produce further discoverable material if needed.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, responded to a letter from defense counsel regarding assurances for Ghislaine Maxwell’s anonymity in the criminal proceedings. The Government stated that Maxwell’s name has not appeared on the public docket and that any documents containing her name are protected by a Protective Order. The Government also indicated it will not call Maxwell as a witness at trial and does not provide detailed previews of its case presentation.  Furthermore, the Government asserted it has no obligation to allow third parties input on trial proceedings and that legal precedent does not permit trials conducted under seal or restricting public access. Finally, the Government noted that UK privacy laws are not applicable and the Crime Victims' Rights Act does not apply due to Maxwell not being a victim of child sexual exploitation.

On May 3, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Audrey Strauss, produced discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330). The materials, stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_02753399 through SDNY_GM_02753431, include photographs and are governed by a Protective Order dated July 31, 2020. The Government states it will promptly produce additional discoverable material if it becomes aware of any.

On May 3, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, via United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, produced discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330). The materials, stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_02753399 through SDNY_GM_02753431, include photographs designated as “Confidential” and governed by a Protective Order issued on July 31, 2020. The Government states it will promptly produce additional discoverable materials if identified. EFTA00022511 is listed as one of the provided files.

The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York is providing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell, inmate 02879-509, at the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY, related to the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The materials were sent via Federal Express on May 21, 2021, by Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney.

On May 21, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent a disc containing discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY. The disc’s password was “Very truly yours, AUDREY STRAUSS.”

The U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent discovery materials related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to the Metropolitan Detention Center’s Legal Department. The materials are intended for Ghislaine Maxwell (inmate 02879-509). The communication was sent on June 10, 2021.

On June 10, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent a communication via FedEx to the Legal Department of the MDC—Metropolitan Detention Center regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The communication included the password for a disc containing discovery materials related to the case.

On June 21, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, sent a court subpoena to Dana Bennett of Lockheed Martin Co. The subpoena is attached to the email correspondence.

On June 22, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, via Assistant United States Attorney Audrey Strauss, issued a court subpoena to Lockheed Martin. The subpoena, relating to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell*, requires Lockheed Martin to appear before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, to testify and produce records of any transactions with Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Air Ghislaine Inc. Failure to comply will result in contempt of court and potential civil and criminal penalties.

On August 12, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent a communication via FedEx to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department regarding the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The communication included the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell (case number 02879-509). It was sent by Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney.

On October 4, 2021, the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, sent discovery related to the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to Ghislaine Maxwell, currently incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn. The correspondence confirms Maxwell’s inmate registration number (02879-509).

On October 12, 2021, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Audrey Strauss, notified attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell regarding potential evidence to be introduced at trial in the case *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330). The government intends to present exhibits demonstrating Maxwell’s involvement in facilitating access for other men to women, alongside her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The government also plans to call a witness, identified as Ms. [Name], who was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein between 2005 and 2006, and anticipates she will testify about documentary evidence related to the charges, including scheduling sexualized massages for Epstein with underage girls. This evidence is considered admissible as direct evidence and potentially under Rule 404(b) for demonstrating intent and knowledge. All information is governed by a Protective Order issued on July 31, 2020.

A court subpoena was issued to T-Mobile requesting subscriber records for the phone number between 2000-2005 in the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The appearance date and time for T-Mobile to produce the records is November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906. Failure to comply will result in contempt of court and potential civil and criminal penalties.

A court subpoena was issued to an individual to appear and testify in the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 906 at 40 Foley Square. The subpoena demands the individual produce a birth certificate. Failure to comply will result in contempt of court and potential civil and criminal penalties. The subpoena was issued by Audrey Strauss, Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on July 28, 2021.

A court subpoena is issued to Pnitebr atatto Piztrirt for November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 906, 40 Foley Square, to testify in the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). Failure to appear will result in contempt of court, civil sanctions, criminal penalties, and other legal consequences. The subpoena is issued by Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

A court subpoena was issued to appear before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 906, 40 Foley Square, New York, to testify in the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). Personal appearance is required, and failure to comply will result in contempt of court, civil sanctions, and criminal penalties. The subpoena was issued by Audrey Strauss, Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

A court subpoena was issued to Lockheed Martin on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. in Courtroom 906, 40 Foley Square, New York City. The subpoena demands that Lockheed Martin appear to testify in the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell*, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). Lockheed Martin is required to produce records of any transactions with Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, Air Ghislaine Inc., a/k/a Shititka Air Inc., a/k/a Freedom Air International Inc. Failure to comply will result in contempt of court and potential civil and criminal penalties. The subpoena was issued by Audrey Strauss, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on June 21, 2021.
